item.title: [Infographic] 16 years of Banking Data…and beyond
item.description: Originaly published on LinkedIn, March 6 2016 For the full size version click here The Data – 1.5 million rows across 16 files were brought into the analysis. Each file contained a specific year and each row a specific branch. The Math – For the forecasting, the model methodology used was ARIMA (Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average). This kind of model works well for time series analysis. To see the full R Markup report describing how each model was chosen click here.

item.title: 5 things I learned from open banking data
item.description: Original published on LinkedIn, February 10 2016 Banks and other financial institutions submit to the FDIC a report of all of the money held for deposit at each of their branches. A compilation of the reports from each bank is available as a single dataset on the FDIC’s website. Here are 5 insights from analyzing the most recent dataset: In 2015, $10.6 trillion dollars in total deposits were reported – This was the first eye opener for me; this number is a 1 followed by 13 zeroes.
